snippet: A signature issue for the mayor has drawn opposition from the middle- and working-class communities it is meant to help, with residents and civic leaders saying their concerns have been ignored.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio is struggling to gain support for his affordable housing plan 11 months after declaring issue as central to his second year in office; de Blasio faces unexpected amount of opposition from local leaders in communities that he pledged to help, and his staff are trying new strategy to draw supporters to his plan.

byline.original: By MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM and MIREYA NAVARRO

lead_paragraph: A signature issue for the mayor has drawn opposition from the middle- and working-class communities it is meant to help, with residents and civic leaders saying their concerns have been ignored.

headline.main: Mayor de Blasio Seeks to Rebuild Momentum for Affordable Housing Plan
headline.print_headline: Mayor Tries to Win Over Critics of Housing Plan
